title: Billericay Town goalkeeper heads home injury-time equaliser against former club Sutton in FA Cup
text:
Goalkeeper Alan Julian headed home a dramatic equaliser in injury-time against his former club Sutton United to ensure Billericay Town will be in the hat for the FA Cup first round.

The 36-year-old former Brentford, Stevenage and Gillingham stopper raced forward after his side were awarded a free kick in the dying moments with Sutton leading through Omar Bugiel's eighth minute strike on Saturday.

And Julian rescued his side by rising above the defence to direct a deft header into the corner of the net.

Billericay goalkeeper Alan Julian headed home a dramatic equaliser in injury-time

The 36-year-old raced forward after his side were awarded a free kick in the dying moments

Julian rescued his side by rising above the defence to direct his deft header into the corner

🏆GOAL CAM | Keeper @jules_alan with the injury time equaliser at @suttonunited to keep us in the hat for Monday’s @EmiratesFACup 1st Rd draw draw 🙌🏻 pic.twitter.com/t8TlKIqmj5 — Billericay Town FC (@BTFC) October 19, 2019

Afterwards Julian admitted it was his first ever goal in a 17-year senior career spanning nine clubs and over 450 appearances.

The two sides will meet again in a fourth qualifying round replay at the New Lodge on Tuesday night.

Billericay Town and Sutton United will be in the draw for the first round which will be televised live on BBC on Monday night.
description: Goalkeeper Alan Julian headed home a dramatic equaliser in injury-time against his former club Sutton United to ensure Billericay Town will be in the hat for the FA Cup first round.
